com.pb.sawdust.io

Class StreamConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.io.StreamConnector

  • public class StreamConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    The StreamConnector class provides static convenience methods for connecting InputStreams to OutputStreams.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
      The default buffer size to use when connecting streams.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StreamConnector()

      Connect an input stream to an output stream, reading as much from the input stream as possible.
      static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is, java.io.OutputStream os, long maxBytes)
      Connect an input stream to an output stream using a the default buffer size, reading at most a specified number of bytes.
      static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is, java.io.OutputStream os, long maxBytes, int bufferSize)
      Connect an input stream to an output stream, reading at most a specified number of bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • connectStreams

        public static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is,
                  java.io.OutputStream os,
                  long maxBytes,
                  int bufferSize)
        Connect an input stream to an output stream, reading at most a specified number of bytes. This method will not close either stream.
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream to read from.
        os - The output stream to write to.
        maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes to read/write.
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer to use when connecting the streams.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes transferred between the streams.

      • connectStreams

        public static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is,
                  java.io.OutputStream os,
                  long maxBytes)
        Connect an input stream to an output stream using a the default buffer size, reading at most a specified number of bytes. This method will not close either stream.
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream to read from.
        os - The output stream to write to.
        maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes to read/write.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes transferred between the streams.

      • connectStreams

        public static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is,
                  java.io.OutputStream os,
                  int bufferSize)
        Connect an input stream to an output stream, reading as much from the input stream as possible. That is, data will continue to be read from the input stream until it signals that it has no more data, or it (or the output stream) throws an exception. This method will not close either stream.
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream to read from.
        os - The output stream to write to.
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer to use when connecting the streams.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes transferred between the streams.

      • connectStreams

        public static long connectStreams(java.io.InputStream is,
                  java.io.OutputStream os)
        Connect an input stream to an output stream using a the default buffer size, reading as much from the input stream as possible. That is, data will continue to be read from the input stream until it signals that it has no more data, or it (or the output stream) throws an exception. This method will not close either stream.
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream to read from.
        os - The output stream to write to.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes transferred between the streams.
